title: What could possibly mess up my javascript tooltip windows after updating from 106 to 118.0.2?
content:
I have a script that shows tooltips when you hover with a mouse pointer on an element. It worked before I updated to 108.0.2. I then updated to the current version (119.0.1) in hopes to fix the problem, but still no tooltips show up. I wonder why. Do you have any idea?

P.S. In the "load" event handler (this is when the window loads) I add mouse event handlers to "A" elements to catch "mouseenter, mouseleave," and "mousemove" events. Then, in the same "load" event handler, I create invisible "SPAN" element that would serve as a tooltip. I then add this invisible element to the "BODY" using "document.body.insertAdjacentElement('beforeend', ..." The event handlers for mouse events change the "style.display" property of the tooltip element to render it visible or vice versa, depending on where the mouse pointer is. Nothing fancy.

Thanks
creator: antizilla

title: Screenshot now only copying part of the page
content: About a month ago, I had no issues taking a screenshot of what's displayed or entire page. Now, whenever I take a screenshot, it copies only 3/5's of the page (from the left margin to roughly 3/5ths of the page both displayed or entire). My settings in about:config have not been changed (well, they are changed but at the same settings as when 'Take Screenshot' worked and now only copying 3/5ths of the page).
creator: PH8978

title: bookmarks stopped working
content:
When I select "bookmark this tab", in the Firefox browser, I used to get the window allowing you to choose where to put the new bookmark. This 'bookmark location' window no longer appears so you don't know where the bookmark has gone. Prior to now, this feature has always worked fine.

I quit Firebox and reopened it but the problem remains.

I'm using Firefox 119.0.1 (64 bit) (the most current vers.) on a Macbook Pro running Ventura 13.3. I switched from Chrome to Firefox on this new Mac.

Please help!

Thanks very much.

kdivad
creator: kdivad111

content: I can't print some email content using the print icon at the top of the email in firefox, yet in Google Chrome and Microsoft Edge everything prints just fine. title: Lockup on Firefox
content:
Firefox has been locking up for the last several months. It happened today and all I can do is close it on the task bar. It will not close via the X in the top right hand corner. I have 32 GB of memory and when I open Task Manager, it shows 16 processes running with 8 of them in efficiency Mode, with no CPU in use. My only option at this point is to move to a new browser. What can I do to help you with my issue? When this happens, it only shows a line with an arrow at each side of it. <-->. I receive no error message.

I am using Firefox 119.0.1 64 bit on Windows 11 Version 23H2 Build 2263.12506

Help Me!
creator: dwilliams131
